Used predictive analysis to predict the number of guests for any given night to maximize occupancy and increase revenue. Documented monthly e-commerce performance reports in MS Word and created MS PowerPoint presentations for higher management. * Defined KPI and metrics to measure business's success. © Part of diverse, cross-functional teams working towards fulfillment of corporate goals and productivity. Implemented SQL queries using joins and sub queries to retrieve data from the database. prowect MANAGER-INTERN | © = =Managed project requirements using JIRA and Confluence. © = Collected, cleaned, and analyzed data using IFTTT, WeWiredWeb, and MS Excel using functions like Pivot Tables and graphs. © Created mockups and wireframes; documented use cases, activity diagrams, sequence diagrams, and workflow. © = Analyzed and reviewed developer Python and HTML codes. © =©Prepared and executed test plans including documenting and resolving issues. . Documented Business Requirement Documents (BRDs) and Functional Requirement Documents (FRDs). atcat MANAGER-INTERN | Implemented advanced MS Excel functionalities like VLOOKUP, Pivot Tables to forecast revenue based on historical data. © Analyzed old detection cases using JIRA tickets and Salesforce to determine which products have maximum False/True Positives and False/True Negatives. Conducted market analysis and research on other threat intelligence companies to see how they differ from each other. Created innovation games to help engineers decide product features. Coordinated with Product Manager to gather requirements and make modifications and corrections to the product specific documents. Certifications * Scrum Fundamentals Certified (April, 2016) © Microsoft Project 2016: Essential Training (February, 2016) * Hootsuite Certificate Courseware (October, 2015) * IBM DB2 Database and Application Fundamentals (October, 2013) Technical Skills * Database: Oracle 91, MySOL * Software/Tools: VB, MS Visio, Tableau, MS Project Professional, Salesforce, SharePoint Education (MAY, 2016) MS INFORMATION SYSTEMS-BUSINESS ANALYTICS (AUGUST, 2013) BE INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY Academic Projects ANALYTICS PROJECT (2016) e Used regression analysis, Tableau, and forecasting to conclude which states in US should stop the production of GE crops, soil damage, and which crops can be excluded from being produced genetically. DATA WAREHOUSING FOR (2015) © Offered a system design solution to a start-up based on requirements of and data provided by the company. Proposed a data warehouse management plan to manage inventory, sales, and customer data in order to help in day-to-day operations. The plan included gathering requirements, choosing KPI, data quality and data sources analysis, dimensional modeling, ETL system requirements, and budgeting. SUPPLY CHAIN MANAGEMENT FOR [J CONSTRUCTIONS PVT. LTD. (2015) * Analyzed operations data to propose a business plan using advanced MS Excel functions like VLOOKUP, Pivot tables, and linear regression. Aimed at improving overhead costs and improved the profit margin of the company by 1.5% per project.

cv_text: Jordan Kirtley Business Analyst Phone 305-730-3464 Linkedin linkedin.com/in/jordanzkirtley E-mail jordanzkirtley@gmail.com Twitter twitter.com/jordanzkirtley Insightful entry-level business analyst with skills in financial modeling and AWS. Excited to deliver profitable insights at WCS. As MBA student at University of Miami, used financial modeling and guided team of 5 to raise $5,000 for local animal shelter. Education 2017 - 2019 MBA University of Miami Marketing and Sales Project * Conducted senior project in market segmentation, branding, and promotion that raised $5,000 for the Broward County Animal Shelter. * Awarded the Catherine L. Gallardo scholarship for charity work. * Conducted rigorous financial modeling to find best project path. * Recruited and managed team of 5 students and community members to implement project strategy. President, Student Economics Club * Led energetic group of 30+ engaged business students to analyze business trends and build lasting relationships. * Supported and organized 10+ club events such as forums to discuss valuation, strategy, capital markets, and venture capitalism. Pursued Educational Excellence * Excelled in accounting, macroeconomics, marketing, and statistics. * Admitted into Masters Scholar program for academic excellence. 2013 - 2017 BS Business Administration Florida State University * Vice President, Association for Business Communication. * Completed 6-credit senior project in financial modeling. Additional Activities 2015 - 2019 Whitewater Videographer * Chased rafts down Class V rivers daily to create and sell trip videos. * Redesigned pricing scheme to reap 40% more revenue than average. Volunteer Driver, Broward County Animal Shelter * Drove vanloads of 50+ cats and dogs per month to rescues. * Analyzed & restructured loading to fit 20% more animals per trip. Eagle Scout, BSA * Recognized for work ethic and interpersonal skills. * Completed Eagle project that raised $4,300 for disabled in Ghana. Skills financial modeling future state assessment gap analysis
